title: 111_s1603
content: The Act titled "Veterans Education Tuition Support Act of 2009" or "VETS Act of 2009" provides tuition relief for postsecondary students called to military service. The VETS Act of 2009 offers tuition relief for postsecondary students who need to withdraw from college due to military service, ensuring a refund of tuition and fees for the affected payment period. The VETS Act of 2009 provides tuition relief for postsecondary students who withdraw from college due to military service, guaranteeing a refund of tuition and fees for the affected payment period, excluding payments made through scholarships or funds awarded under this title. The VETS Act of 2009 guarantees tuition relief for postsecondary students who withdraw from college due to military service, including a waiver of repayment for withdrawals necessitated by service in the uniformed services. Loan forgiveness is also authorized for students whose withdrawal is due to military service. The VETS Act of 2009 ensures tuition relief for postsecondary students who withdraw from college due to military service, including loan forgiveness for outstanding principle and accrued interest on any loan assistance received under part B. The VETS Act of 2009 provides tuition relief for postsecondary students who withdraw from college due to military service, including loan forgiveness for outstanding loan assistance under part B. The VETS Act of 2009 offers tuition relief for postsecondary students who withdraw from college due to military service, including loan forgiveness for outstanding loan assistance under part D or E. The Secretary will reimburse institutions for cancelled Perkins loans, minus any loans cancelled that were made. The Secretary will reimburse institutions for cancelled Perkins loans made from Federal capital contributions, with payments made within 3 months of filing an application. Loan eligibility and limits apply. Loan eligibility and limits for students are not affected by amounts returned, forgiven, or waived by the Secretary due to withdrawal for service in the uniformed services. The amendments made by this Act will affect loan limits for students in the uniformed services, with the effective date starting after the enactment of the Act. The period of protection for students in the uniformed services starts 30 days before reporting for service and ends upon their return.
